intro: Mentha hakka, commonly known as Hakka mint, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a serrated margin. Its small, tubular flowers are usually purple or violet, arranged in whorls along the stem. The essential oils extracted from its leaves are widely used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent.
